x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.potential_impact:
1. Increased reach: Convert unmet legal needs into actionable referrals.

  2. Faster assistance: Reduce correspondence time for urgent non-violent cases (target SLA for emergency eviction or service denial).

  3. Local dispute de-escalation: Increase mediated resolutions via local paralegals and reduce escalation to courts for suitable civil disputes.

  4. Transparency & trust: Provide claimants with visible case status, lowering abandonment rates and increasing satisfaction.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: A large share of Nigerians faces serious barriers in accessing legal help for non-violent civil and administrative issues (land disputes, service denial, discrimination, tenancy and consumer complaints). These barriers they face yield these direct consequences: • People delay or forgo legal remedies because of cost, distance, or complexity. • It becomes hard to triage and route civil/legal complaints to the right local actor (law clinic, NGO, paralegal, regulatory body). • It becomes hard for plaintiffs to track case progress or get timely referrals.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

No ServiceNow Products listed for this solution

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  1. Partner directory & contact APIs

  2. Secure cloud hosting and legal-grade data encryption; retention and consent management compliant with Nigeria Data Protection Regulation (NDPR).

  3. Geolocation or LGA mapping service to map hotspots.

  4. Document/photo handling and basic OCR for intake evidence.

  5. Offline-first mobile sync for field paralegals and low-connectivity areas.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  1. Limited partner capacity / slow responses

  2. Data privacy & consent risks

  3. False or malicious reports (fraud/defamation risk)

  4. Digital divide (digital literacy barriers)

  5. Reliance on cooperation from formal institutions
